D137D80033F2427F89149B125F1F986F.description: plan, prepare, and serve a food item or items according to set criteria

891DA26D74E74A5FBA9CA0685B8AB7C6.description: demonstrate the ability to manage time effectively in food preparation

F4C8E17004E843E698F4EB55DA6F70CB.description: demonstrate the correct use of foodpreparation techniques (e.g., stirring, beating, whipping, chopping, broiling, frying)

40B8866954764A119ED33412DF4C8BC0.description: demonstrate the ability to measure quantities accurately (e.g., use different strategies for measuring wet and dry ingredients; level off excess amounts; measure liquids at eye level)

89837239077449DBA7A22CD0E26DC50F.description: demonstrate the ability to safely use, maintain, clean, and store tools and equipment used in food preparation

8BDC4DB6967C4FA5AD8E4062898BB02C.description: demonstrate the ability to adapt recipes to accommodate specific dietary needs

AE943F410B3846B9A90F70B053030DAF.description: demonstrate the ability to follow a recipe

87524D3883D34C688DD2D360EE54F4F5.description: identify and select appropriate tools, equipment, and ingredients for use in food preparation

3C5A56BA57C84D2786BD56C3F539EB22.description: Food Preparation: demonstrate skills needed in food preparation.

F950B37841644EC1B7D0A46AC27C9DE8.description: follow appropriate protocols to ensure food safety (e.g., cook foods to recommended temperatures; keep hot foods hot and cold foods cold; store food appropriately; wipe tops of cans before opening; check "best-before" dates; demonstrate awareness of common allergenic ingredients)

43FDB77508B846B19D0F9FC03F103A7F.description: use safe food-handling practices to prevent cross-contamination by pathogens, parasites, and allergens in the food-preparation area (e.g., wash fresh produce; sanitize cutting boards after contact with meat products; sanitize implements that come into contact with allergens when preparing food for or with people with known allergies; sanitize work surfaces; replace or sanitize sponges or cloths frequently; use proper clean-up procedures)

A17AB054BB274C8897E0EC36E0F0FE9B.description: use appropriate personal hygiene practices to prevent contamination of food (e.g., wash hands frequently; cover a cough or sneeze in their sleeve; use gloves to cover cuts or wounds; tie hair back)

D123114D0FA54EB1B61A19ED3F4EA676.description: outline the causes and symptoms of foodborne illnesses (e.g., E. coli poisoning, botulism poisoning, Clostridium perfringens poisoning, salmonellosis, listeriosis) and techniques for preventing these illnesses

CDCC1E255301422C96D4C71F9B564AB0.description: Food Safety: demonstrate an understanding of practices that ensure or enhance food safety;

845C367EA0A94B7C91CD4B089849814F.description: demonstrate an understanding of appropriate emergency responses to common accidents associated with food preparation (e.g., cuts, burns, scalds, fires)

3709C5224B924FE59C59711C3772E293.description: demonstrate an understanding of safe practices within the food-preparation area (e.g., safely handle hot foods; prevent spatters, scalds, and cuts; wipe up spills immediately)

223E108D6C664B42A32301EB3EAED31F.description: describe common accidents that can occur in the kitchen (e.g., cuts, burns, fires, falls, poisoning, electric shocks)

666CB0B19A7346E5BF934F6D0DAF56FA.description: Kitchen Safety: demonstrate an understanding of practices that ensure or enhance kitchen safety;

290D9EED5E2E419CBAFD21950DADFBBB.description: demonstrate an understanding of health, safety, and environmental issues related to food supply and production (e.g., risks associated with bioaccumulation of pesticides and hormones, risks of contamination during food production), and identify legislation that is designed to protect Canadian consumers (e.g., Canada Agricultural Products Act, Food and Drugs Act)

E7B672D0CCB347919C5F65F4CDAEF1DE.description: explain the effect of various environmental protection laws and regulations on food supply and production (e.g., policies related to forest preservation, fuel emission standards, pesticide use)

0A923C7827604288A2AA533325F6E7E4.description: explain the effect on the environment of various agricultural trends (e.g., growing crops for biofuels) and food-production technologies (e.g., types of farm equipment, types of energy sources, climate-control techniques, genetic engineering of foods)

D52D4B749E8D46E39863C852D0856A02.description: describe how consumer food choices affect the environment, locally and globally (e.g., demand for imported food increases the amount of energy used in transportation; choice of overpackaged products increases the volume of waste going to landfills; choice of fair-trade products supports sustainable farming and small-scale farmers; demand for local produce supports farmers' markets and reduces use of fossil fuels)

F2F81F71D3774DC390742CFF6A93F80A.description: Food Production and the Environment: demonstrate an understanding of the effects of food production on the environment.

7F8FCD595FE943FF9FB4E1DCCBF5A53F.description: analyse the effect of various trends in agriculture and aquaculture (e.g., organic farming, use of antibiotics, fish farming, genetic engineering, greenhouse food production) on local and global food supply and production

10951AC1EE724360B3B07DDE11EC2F60.description: explain the effect of various economic, social, and political factors (e.g., debt-repayment obligations, demand for cash crops, oil prices, freetrade agreements, trade embargos or bans, controls on fishing and hunting, import-export restrictions designed to prevent or control outbreaks of disease) on food supply and production

637356F7576F4A15A6F0FD8FBA85992B.description: explain the effects of various agricultural methods (e.g., crop rotation, integrated pest management, fallow fields, intercropping, no tillage) on local or global food production and yields

1DEFF0DC1B1C449192CBC65B346C7EF5.description: outline how geographical factors, physical conditions, and natural disasters (e.g., climate, weather, soil conditions, proximity to water, mudslides, floods, earthquakes) affect food supply and production

8382C92192114A818D81BA701C8721E9.description: Food Production and Supply: demonstrate an understanding of various factors that affect food production and supply;

3E577FF54AF34C48AB82D4F397798650.description: demonstrate the ability to act to combat food insecurity at the local and global level (e.g., write to elected representatives or government officials; volunteer with a breakfast program; fundraise for community water wells; plant trees; buy products from women-led cooperatives; become involved in a community garden; work on a local farm)

7D622F51E04841CF915C64E229FE0B05.description: explain how various food distribution systems affect food security, locally and globally (e.g., farmers' markets supply local foods from identifiable sources; large supermarkets provide increased access to foods year-round but may contribute to lack of access to foods in other countries; fair-trade networks guarantee the working conditions of the food producers but may lead to choices to grow cash crops rather than food for local consumption)

887CF2E8FBA64C75AD39848C6486CF34.description: describe the relationships between poverty, food insecurity, poor nutrition, and poor health

6B0B10D9EC2546F8BD08523206A5E529.description: explain how social, cultural, economic, and political factors (e.g., gender, ethnicity, religious or political affiliation, employment, income) contribute to nutritional inequalities among people within the same community

8D4CDBE9E48C413EB7E1D72496EF1C61.description: explain the importance of each of the key components of food security (e.g., availability, accessibility, adequacy, acceptability, sustainability)

E73DEE926CD14D1DBD9C5A49A80299D4.description: Food Security: demonstrate an understanding of various factors involved in achieving and maintaining food security;

ED826C03914F41C0B6E5A1ED540D966F.description: plan and prepare a food item or items using an ingredient that is currently being marketed as a functional food (e.g., flax seed, high-protein pasta, blueberries, pomegranates, chia)

BEF5DE9FB5D6496BBA511BE41A8D7154.description: explain some ways in which scientific research on nutrition and health has influenced government legislation and policy (e.g., nutrition labelling requirements, trans-fat-reduction campaigns, school food and beverage policies, policies to implement daily physical activity in schools)

61BD82D3CEF74E1889DEDC3B163B7D88.description: describe the effects on overall health of various popular diets and food trends (e.g., low-carbohydrate diets, promotion of antioxidants and phytochemicals)

A2070BC3B3544423849400969F1707CA.description: explain why people adopt various eating patterns (e.g., vegetarian diet, slow food diet, organic diet, weight-loss program)

1DE315EECC0442FBB713CABF79B2DCE0.description: analyse new and emerging food- and nutrition-related products and services (e.g., additives, functional foods, whole-wheat pasta, soy products, energy drinks, vitamin-enhanced drinks, local food initiatives, agri-tourism, molecular gastronomy, the slow food movement) in terms of their real or perceived benefits to Canadian consumers (e.g., health benefits, time savings, environmental benefits)

758E5DA934204B17A0A7BD0044DFF5E4.description: Trends and Patterns in Food and Nutrition: demonstrate an understanding of current Canadian trends and patterns in nutritional guidelines and in food production and consumption.

33F1847717D645CF8AFD5FBB7DFB55FD.description: plan and prepare a food item or items to meet the nutritional needs of people with a specific illness or disease

27F88584072042959D3089A4C49589B8.description: explain the scientific basis for particular strategies to prevent food- and nutritionrelated diseases and illnesses

7DD3DEB67AEA4B92BDF6ADDE95496D8C.description: describe and explain the reasons for the nutrient needs and dietary requirements of people with specific illnesses or diseases (e.g., diabetes, HIV/AIDS) or people undergoing particular medical treatments (e.g., people undergoing chemotherapy, people taking particular pharmaceutical drugs or drug combinations)

EECBC1E1883A4FC19E26FE64FE6C41A7.description: explain how various factors (e.g., heredity/ genetics, socio-economic status, geography, lifestyle, activity levels) can contribute to nutrition-related illnesses and health conditions

BCB5AE32FD0A4FC385A3FA13EACE9C2C.description: identify social and emotional conditions that may result in unhealthy eating patterns and contribute to illness and disease (e.g., busy schedules, expectations related to body shape, stress, scarcity of resources)

4825C11774C24D92BB9E6B0785BC70FE.description: describe some eating practices that help in the prevention and management of particular health conditions (e.g., allergies, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, osteoporosis, kidney disease)

75E258C6BFCB4E31B9D229342CC5EC51.description: Nutrition and Disease: demonstrate an understanding of the relationships between nutrition, health, and disease;

44A68C17A320472EA57E113CEE126DA6.description: plan and prepare a food item or items appropriate to the nutritional needs of people at a specific stage of the lifespan

80DF13E078AE45F28422995284CAB2B1.description: describe food and nutrition products that are designed to meet the needs of people at different stages of the lifespan (e.g., single-serving products, baby foods, meal-replacement drinks)

455C06B1B8EC4F408A3E4DA80EA8BD55.description: explain how a variety of factors (e.g., familial, social, emotional, cultural, religious, economic, geographic, ethical, psychological) influence the food choices people make

75D2CECD1E5240C6924877BC84F92737.description: explain how growth and development throughout the lifespan (e.g., during pre-pregnancy, pregnancy, lactation, infancy, childhood, adolescence, later life) affect nutritional needs and food choices

F7F0BEEB5CA3443BAEC27C43419906AF.description: Nutrition throughout the Lifespan: demonstrate an understanding of food- and nutrition-related issues at different stages in the lifespan;

A9FECB9DDB6447EE804F2E3A115CECF1.description: plan and prepare a food item or items to address a specific nutritional deficiency common to Canadians (e.g., prepare a high-fibre snack to address a lack of dietary fibre)

F8DB975FE9CB422CA56E31504ECAB4BB.description: identify factors that can contribute to the poor nutritional status of people in Canada and around the world (e.g., genetic propensity to nutrition-related diseases such as diabetes; decaying infrastructure; natural disasters)

29C2DA8B635C4AC4A8B6599E339F97CA.description: compare their own nutrient intake with that of various population groups in Canada

CA668A6BFB904EA8A0EE7DA9B12D433E.description: compare their own nutrient intake to that recommended in current Canadian guidelines for people of their age, gender, and lifestyle (e.g., Dietary Reference Intakes)

DE968DA3C7524C5399E610A5FBCF0012.description: Nutritional Status: demonstrate an understanding of their nutrient intake and of factors that affect the nutritional status of individuals and groups.

3950EA53EFD642309237E541DE661427.description: explain how various factors affect calorie expenditure (e.g., duration and intensity of exercise, body composition, basal metabolic rate, type of activity)

F2E01AC1D0D2400BBE7317A82AE21CEC.description: explain the concept of energy balance, and describe how energy balance can be achieved (e.g., by changing the quantity and types of food eaten; by changing the type, duration, or intensity of exercise)

4D086108A32F4A14A989E8C98B02632C.description: analyse foods to determine their macronutrient content (i.e., the percentage of calories from protein, fat, and carbohydrates)

C53DCFF7720A4D4EA60A6C9E36D38DFC.description: describe the processes of food digestion, absorption, and metabolism

AB8321722F544A178A6DC7848E3C6105.description: Energy Balance: demonstrate an understanding of the physical processes involved in maintaining energy balance;

05FFCE1317DC4CB2A20CAEEAC0348938.description: prepare a food item or items to reflect specific recommendations in Canada's Food Guide (e.g., reduce fat or sodium; use whole grains, dark green or orange vegetables, beans or lentils)

291A9E7E393246B18A5D436080D07257.description: compare the key recommendations in Canada's Food Guide to those in food guides from other countries (e.g., Dietary Guidelines for Americans, Mediterranean Food Guide, Chinese Food Guide) and food guides designed for special groups (e.g., vegetarians, vegans, diabetics)

C1CB1DDB867D402A88BB06B8850842B2.description: describe research findings that support the recommendations and guidelines in Canada's Food Guide (e.g., research showing that wholegrain products have more vitamins, minerals, and fibre than comparable non-whole-grain products)

CEACE24C70D2487FBC8991209D040C5E.description: outline the main nutrients found in each of the food groups in Canada's Food Guide (e.g., carbohydrates in the Grain Products group, protein in the Meat and Alternatives and Milk and Alternatives groups)

9C33900E70C643ACB1CECA6BCFF3B136.description: describe the evolution of Canada's Food Guide over time (e.g., changes in name, food groups, objectives, serving amounts, key recommendations)

25CA5AC16C88490FA77137AE819313F6.description: Food Guides: demonstrate an understanding of Canada�s Food Guide and its role in promoting physical health;

61211DA6A0C74D278B6D78A2437DC991.description: plan and prepare a food item or items to ensure optimal nutrient content and retention (e.g., choose nutrient-dense foods; steam rather than boil vegetables)

992AF6742CAA4BDE9BE0C3CD5703BCF9.description: describe the nutrient content of specific foods, using available food and nutrition information (e.g., Nutrition Facts tables, food company nutrition information, nutrient-values databases, information provided by health and nutrition professionals)

8D70E1021A254613AE85CBABE64EB568.description: describe the causes and symptoms of nutrient deficiencies (e.g., rickets, pellagra, goitre, anaemia, osteoporosis, scurvy, kwashiorkor, marasmus, beriberi) and excesses (e.g., iron toxicity, fluorosis)

A7720F0158ED49669FCA5F781DDBA5EF.description: describe sources and functions of macronutrients (i.e., carbohydrates, fats, proteins), micronutrients (i.e., vitamins, minerals), and water

B26CB06EB488407A93F2C1E2DEC3CC33.description: Nutrients: demonstrate an understanding of nutrients and their connection to physical health;

25AC0A289F174AD6A6ED9AF5C1B2E671.description: demonstrate an understanding of the general research process by reflecting on and evaluating their own research, inquiry, and communication skills

5977E73137694A49866A106320855D5E.description: clearly communicate the results of their inquiries (e.g., write clearly, organize ideas logically, use language conventions properly), and follow APA conventions for acknowledging sources (e.g., generate a reference list in APA style)

6F329E3111C6481AA5FF382463A35803.description: use terms relating to nutrition and health correctly (e.g., macronutrient, micronutrient, nutrient deficiency, nutrient retention, food security, water potability, functional food)

846A7954420A4AE7AB37E1EDBA45FA37.description: use an appropriate format (e.g., brochure, flyer, poster, report, multimedia presentation) to communicate the results of their research and inquiry effectively for a specific purpose and audience

3567C4276F084C7AAF4ABE374540572B.description: Communicating and Reflecting: communicate the results of their research and inquiry clearly and effectively, and reflect on and evaluate their research, inquiry, and communication skills.

FF80943C405641218D6673AF3758BF81.description: synthesize findings and formulate conclusions (e.g., weigh and connect information to determine the answer to their research question)

09598119C70C4412A32F044F5EB3774F.description: demonstrate academic honesty by documenting the sources of all information generated through research

90FA1BE0AD394B02A89319D1CB4D67A7.description: analyse and interpret research information (e.g., compare information from various sources; make connections; identify gaps that necessitate further research)

F59444C53ED14499B2DCE402DACCC596.description: record and organize information and key ideas using a variety of formats (e.g., journals, logs, report outlines, notes, graphic organizers, audio/visual/digital records)

BCF50EE54C824675B986F01694D54138.description: assess various aspects of information gathered from primary and secondary sources (e.g., accuracy, relevance, reliability, inherent values and bias, voice)

30194B2A0A004AEA8551DB2B1A9C43A9.description: Processing Information: assess, record, analyse, and synthesize information gathered through research and inquiry;

93B364E164484994B012239EED8950B2.description: based on preliminary research, for each investigation formulate a hypothesis, thesis statement, or research question, and use it to focus their research

E1EF71236D354D27BE134D29B4F5151C.description: locate and select information relevant to their investigations from a variety of primary sources (e.g., interviews, surveys, observations, field research, data sets from Statistics Canada) and/or secondary sources (e.g., research reports, textbooks, advertisements, brochures, newspaper and magazine articles, websites)

F30E56805A0349F7AD66251912FD3568.description: create appropriate research plans to investigate their selected topics (e.g., outline purpose and method; identify sources of information; develop research tools such as surveys or questionnaires), ensuring that their plans follow guidelines for ethical research

963356CA77784B808EDDF1198D504663.description: Investigating: create research plans, and locate and select information relevant to their chosen topics, using appropriate social science research and inquiry methods;

7A50220CD2A045E7828F1E1F5B85B88D.description: formulate effective questions to guide their research and inquiry

EB68837144D7451989A4AF52FDFE75B4.description: identify key concepts (e.g., through discussion, brainstorming, use of visual organizers) related to their selected topics

17CB68E5977B47FDA871EFD384EF1B6C.description: explore a variety of topics related to nutrition and health (e.g., nutritional needs throughout the lifespan, nutritional status of different groups) to identify topics for research and inquiry

4920519ED36149D8B5F8BACA138EC27D.description: Exploring: explore topics related to nutrition and health, and formulate questions to guide their research;
